bibl.title: Letter from Lucy T. Howard to Philip Showalter Hench, October 23, 1946

div1.p: Howard informs Hench that she has found important letters written by Reed and Kelly and will send him copies.

div1.head: Letter from Lucy T. Howard to Philip Showalter Hench, October 23, 1946
div1.p:
Today while dusting
books - I came across a copy of
‘Walter Reed & Yellow Fever’, by
Dr H. A. Kelly, & saw that there
were some papers stuck in it.
To my joy & delight - there was
(original)
the manuscript letter Walter
Reed had written Father -
the one in which he said
“with the aid of Howard &
Kerosene, the. We are going to knock
them out.” It is a very thrilling
letter - written from Cuba
on January 13, 1900. I am going to
have it photostated at once &
send you the copy of it. Father
doesn't want to let the original
go through the mails. There is
also a note from Dr Kelly about
his book & saying he'd like to
see the letter & a typewritten copy
of a letter Father wrote Dr Kelly.
I'll send you copies of both.

I'm very much pleased to
have at last found something
of real value for you!
